subject: Re: [junit] ClassCastException in JBoss (but only after redeploy)
msgSnippet: ... ooh!  I ll remove that, thanks. ... okay, thanks for that.  Perhaps my problem is a jboss one (not junit at all).  I get the feeling that the
messageBody:
> I'm guessing a class definition is changing during undeploy/redeploy.
> The test somehow holds on to the "old" class definition. The use of
> "loading=false" may exaggerate this problem.

ooh! I'll remove that, thanks.

> Also remember that a class is unique by the tuple of its name and the
> class loader that loads it.

okay, thanks for that. Perhaps my problem is a jboss one (not junit at
all). I get the feeling that the ClassCastException will be thrown by
lots of loading type problems.


cheers, Oliver.

--
Oliver George <me@...>
